dialogues.text: Tell me, my child, what is your name? COSETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm called Cosette. VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosette? She gazes up at him. Hardly knowing why, the little girl trusts this stranger. Valjean picks up the heavy buckets, they head back towards the inn. As they go, they hum `Cas on a Cloud' together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valjean enters with Cosette. Madame Thenardier hurries over. Madame and Monsieur Thenardier try to thieve from Valjean using the same tricks established earlier, but he evades every attempt. Eponine watches silently from a corner. VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found her wandering in the wood This little child, I found her trembling in the shadows. And I am here to help Cosette, And I will settle any debt you may think proper. I will pay what I must pay To take Cosette away. This is a duty I must heed. There is a promise I have made. For I was blind to one in need, I did not see what stood before me. Now your mother is with God. Her suffering is over, And I speak here with her voice, And I stand here in her place, and from this day, and ever more - MADAME THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me take your coat, m'sieur! VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosette shall live in my protection.                                               THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are very welcome here! VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will not forget my vow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a glass! MADAME THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a chair! VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosette shall have a father now. Thenardier turns to his wife. THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What to do? What to say Shall you carry our treasure away? What a gem! What a pearl! Beyond rubies is our little girl! How can we speak of debt? Let's not haggle for darling Colette! MADAME THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosette! THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosette - Dear Fantine - gone to rest - Have we done for her child what is best? Shared our bread - shared each bone - Treated her like she's one of our own! Like our own, m'sieur! VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your feelings do you credit, sir. And I will ease the parting blow. Let us not talk of bargains and bones and greed. He gives Thenardier money. VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now may I say we are agreed? MADAME THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would quite fit the bill If she hadn't so often been ill. Little dear, cost us dear! Medicines are expensive, m'sieur. Not that we begrudged a sou - It's no more than we Christians must do. Valjean gives more money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THENARDIERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One thing more! One small doubt! There are treacherous people about! No offence! Please reflect! Your intentions may not be correct! Valjean hands over more money. VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more! Here's your price! Fifteen hundred for your sacrifice. Come, Cosette, say goodbye. Let's seek out some friendlier sky. Thank you both for Cosette - It won't take you too long to forget. He leads Cosette to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valjean lifts Cosette into the waiting cab. VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where I go, you will be. COSETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you be like a Papa to me? VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Cosette! This is true! I'll be father and mother to you! The cab sets off down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madame Thenardier takes the bunch of notes from her husband's hand and inspects them. THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad! MADAME THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not enough! Through the open door Thenardier sees a man on horseback rattling up to the inn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MADAME THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a copper at the door! What the devil have you done? Javert strides into the inn. JAVERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the child Cosette? MADAME THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's gone with a gent, Didn't tell us where they went, Didn't leave his home address. JAVERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you catch the fellow's name? Both Thenardiers shake their heads. Javert stares once, contemptuously, round the seedy inn, and departs without a further word. Thenardier goes to th doorway to watch him leave. MADAME THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a bloody fool Look at what we got. THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should have struck the iron, Struck it while it's hot. THENARDIER/MADAME THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next time round we'll be here And we're gonna get the lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valjean's cab, moving fast, passes down the road into the city. IN CAB - Valjean has one arm round Cosette to protect her from the jolting of the cab. He gazes at her as she slips into a fitful sleep. VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly I see Suddenly it starts When two anxious hearts Beat as one. Yesterday I was alone Today you walk beside me Something still unclear Something not yet here Has begun. Suddenly the world Seems a different place Somehow full of grace (more)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VALJEAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And delight. How was I to know That so much love Was held inside me? Something fresh and young Something still unsung Fills the night. How was I to know at last That happiness can come so fast? Trusting me the way you do I'm so afraid of failing you Just a child who cannot know That danger follows where I go There are shadows everywhere And memories I cannot share Nevermore alone Nevermore apart You have warmed my heart Like the sun. You have brought the gift of life And love so long denied me. Suddenly I see What I could not see Something suddenly Has begun. He brushes the hair from her face, and satisfies himself that she's comfortable. Then he puts his head out of the window. At the gate into Paris, soldiers are checking documents of occupants of carriages. Valjean slips out of the carriage with Cosette and makes his way along the wall, away from the gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valjean finds a section of tumble down wall and climbs ov

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valjean and Cosette make their way down a darkened street

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valjean and Cosette turn down a narrow street, no longer hurrying. The narrow street turns, and opens out onto the river. Valjean stops. There, on the other side of the river, in light of a lamp, stands Javert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Valjean and Cosette are running - down narrow alleys, into small dark courtyards, not knowing which way to turn Whenever Valjean thinks they've thrown their pursuer, the he is, not far behind. And he's no longer alone. With him are a detachment of soldiers. Javert and his team never seem to run. But he's always there.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. DEAD END
dialogues.text: Valjean and Cosette turn into a street that is walled in high windowless houses. They follow it round a corner to find - a dead end. A high wall before them. They're trapped. Valjean looks round. No way out. Then he sees a nearby la bracket. Hanging from it is the rope that is used to lowe the oil lamp for lighting. He tears off the rope and ties one end round Cosette, beneath her armpits. Then holding the other end, he scales the wall, using the corner to brace himself as he rises. Once on the top, he hauls Cosette up by the rope. Only then does he turn to look do onto the other side. A cloister. A building in the middle, windows glowing. Grave stones black against the white snow. The sound of women's voices, singing a psalm. NUNS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Te lucis ante terminum Rerum Creator poscimus Ut pro tua clementia Sis praesul et custodia... Valjean lowers Cosette down into the garden, and drops do after her. Javert and his men enter the dead end to find them gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valjean crouched low, with Cosette in his arms, holding h still and quiet until Javert is gone. Then he straightens up and looks round. He takes in the sound of singing. NUNS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Procul recedant somnia Et noctium phantasmata (more)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NUNS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hostemque nostrum comprime Ne polluantur corpora... He goes closer to the windows of the building. Through th blurry glass he can make out a chapel, and a line of nuns singing. Valjean continues and sees a man filling in a new grave. The man starts as he sees Valjean. FAUCHELEVENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that? Valjean jumps, takes Cosette protectively into his arms. Turns to answer. FAUCHELEVENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, it's Monsieur Mayor! It's Fauchelevent, now a gardener, still limping from his injury. VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you? FAUCHELEVENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you remember? The cart fell on me!                                                VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monsieur Fauchelevent!                                FAUCHELEVENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saved my life! You got me this job as a gardener! Valjean gazes at him, and remembers. VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you can do the same for me. We need a place of sanctuary. This child and I, we need to disappear. FAUCHELEVENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In this place of Holy Orders You are brought to God's domain May the sisters grant you shelter May their prayers ease your pain. Valjean and Cosette follow him to the convent. VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll give thanks for what is granted What the sisters may ordain Here we pray for new beginnings - Here our lives can start again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valjean looks to the heavens. The camera soars into the a and heads east as dawn breaks over Paris. We rush low ove Paris as the sun comes up, towards the Place de la Bastil

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE CAPTION
dialogues.text: Nine years later The dawn light glows on a massive ELEPHANT. The monument, made of wood and plaster, now ruined and crumbling, stand on a plinth on one side of the wide open square. On the f side, the remains of the great fortress that was the Bastille. In the middle, scaffolding surrounds a half-bui triumphal column, which is being erected to celebrate the new regime.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE CAPTION
dialogues.text: Paris, 1832. The streets that run from the square lead in one directio to the Paris of power and wealth; in the other direction into the slums. The camera sweeps in and down to meet the elephant. A head pops out of one of the elephant's many holes - GAVROCHE, a street urchin. He gives a shrill whistle. At once a dozen more street urchins show themselves, from every crack in the monument's skin. Agile as a monkey, Gavroche drops to the ground, followed by his band.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOLLOW GAVROCHE in as he races down a grand boulevard, dodging the crowds of strolling bourgeoisie and beggars, weaving in and out of the lines of carriages attempting t make their way in either direction. These are the conveyances of the rich, fine gilded coaches with matched horses and footmen on the back. Virtually at a standstill they lend Gavroche a platform as he leaps from coach to coach, a street urchin dancing on the heads of the elite. As he goes, the poor on the pavements sing to the stony- faced rich in their golden high-sprung glory - BEGGARS CHORUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look down and see the beggars at your feet! Look down and show some mercy if you can! Look down and see the sweepings of the street! (more)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEGGARS CHORUS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look down, look down, Upon your fellow man! The fine ladies and grand gentlemen in the carriages aver their eyes, or raise the blinds of their carriage windows to shut out the sight of the losers of their world. Gavroche, bounding over their heads, evading the swipes o liveried footmen, lands on the running board of one particularly grand carriage and begs/taunts the RICH OCCUPANT. GAVROCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Ow do you do? My name's Gavroche! These are my people, here's my patch. Not much to look at - nothing posh! Nothing that you'd call up to scratch. This is my school, my high society! Here in the slums of St Michel. We live on crumbs of humble piety Tough on the teeth - but what the hell! Think you're poor? Think you're free? Follow me! Follow me! BEGGARS CHORUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look down and show some mercy if you can! Look down, look down, upon your fellow man! STILL RUNNING WITH Gavroche as he hops onto the back of another very grand carriage, the traffic now moving at last, hitching a ride on the back - one or two of his gan hop on back of carriage with him, the others run panting after to hear his political lecture. GAVROCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was a time we killed the King We tried to change the world too fast. Now we have got another King, He is no better than the last. This is the land that fought for liberty - Now when we fight we fight for bread! Here is the thing about equality - Everyone's equal when they're dead. Take your place! (more)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAVROCHE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your chance! Vive la France! Vive la France!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The carriage has reached an arch into a courtyard where a crowd of a couple of hundred is gathered outside a house sickness. The carriage stops as its occupant wants to wat what is going on. The street is padded with straw. Many e gaze up at the draped windows. People cross themselves. A priest is seen hurrying into the house, accompanied by tw altar boys. Gavroche jumps off as the carriage stops and joins the cr The crowd is made up of citizens of Paris, student revolutionaries, the poor and beggars. The students hand printed leaflets and try to excite the crowd. STUDENTS/BEGGARS CHORUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look down and show some mercy if                         you can!                                                 Look down, look down, upon your                          fellow man!                                              COURFEYRAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When's it gonna end? BEGGAR 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we gonna live? JOLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's gotta happen now! BEGGAR 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's gotta give! STUDENTS AND BEGGARS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll come, it'll come, it'll come... It'll come, it'll come, it'll come... A student, ENJOLRAS, stands on a raised step, making an impassioned speech with fellow student MARIUS. The occupa of the stopped carriage is MONSIEUR GILLENORMAND, Marius' Grandfather. He is clearly deeply unhappy to see his gran engaged in such an activity. In the crowd a young street girl, EPONINE, has her eyes f longingly on the handsome Marius. ENJOLRAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are the leaders of the land? Where are the swells who run this show?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only one man, General Lamarque                         Speaks for the people here below! Marius looks towards Lamarque's house behind him. ENJOLRAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lamarque is ill and fading fast - Won't last a week out, so they say. MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With all the anger in the land, How long before the Judgement Day? ENJOLRAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before we cut the fat ones down to size? STUDENTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before the barricades arise? Mounted Police ride in to break up the crowd. POLICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look down, look down, don't look us                    in the eye!                                            Look down, look down, stay here and                    you die!                                               The crowd breaks up. The students shout to the crowd: ENJOLRAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow we will return!                               MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell everyone you know                                 COURFEYRAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will show them!                                     COMBEFERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lamarque is the only leader on our                     side!                                                  COURFEYRAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a right to pray for                            Lamarque!                                              JOLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need more people, then the                          police will not dare ride against                      us!                                                    MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vive le General Lamarque!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marius turns to see his Grandfather staring him down, furious. GILLENORMAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any idea of the shame you bring on your family! You're behaving like a child. Gillenormand spies a gun poking out of his jacket. Gillenormand turns to get back in his carriage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through a crack in a door, we see Marius sitting on a tat mattress in a tiny hovel of a room. He is taking out a hunting rifle from under the mattress, wrapped in a rag. eye is caught by the ring on his finger. CLOSE ON a signet ring, a family crest. Marius stares at the ring then takes it off his finger. We reveal EPONINE staring at him through the door. EPONINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey there Monsieur what's new with you? Haven't seen much of you of late. Planning no doubt to change the world? Plotting to overthrow the state? Still living here in this old sewer Might as well doss down in a ditch You still pretending to be poor Everyone knows your Grandpa's rich Marius rushes down the stairs of the slum, Eponine follow We see glimpses of misery off the stairwell. MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you...? EPONINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's lots of things I know MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won't take a franc that I've not earned All of those bridges have been burned. EPONINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like the way you talk Monsieur! MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like the way you always tease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eponine comes to a stop, looking wistfully after Marius. EPONINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little he knows - Little he sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marius is stopped as he exits the front door of the Gorbe Tenement by a passing carriage. Once it passes Marius see two people in the street outside. One is an old gentleman Valjean. The other is a beautiful young girl, Cosette. Th two are giving alms to beggars as they walk back from evening church service. Marius can't take his eyes off Cosette. He's never seen anyone so lovely in his life. We hear the instrumental foreshadowing of `A Heart Full of Love'. As if drawn by Marius's gaze, Cosette looks up and meets his eyes. She too is amazed: he's looking at her as if he already knows her. A second carriage breaks their held gaze. Marius continues on down the street and when he looks bac at that precise moment Cosette looks at him again. Valjean instinctively puts his arm round her, guarding he jealously from this distant boy's gaze. We cut further down the street to an alleyway where the Thenardiers, heavily disguised, are waiting for Valjean's approach with their gang of crooks, Babet, Brujon, Clacquesous, Montparnasse. THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone here, you know your place - Brujon, Babet, Clacquesous - You, Montparnasse, watch for the law - With Eponine - take care. (Montparnasse hurries over                             to the doorway where                                 Eponine was watching                                 Marius)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You turn on the tears! (to Madame Thenardier who                              is holding a baby)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No mistakes, my dears! Thenardier approaches Valjean and lures him into the mout of the alleyway where Madame Thenardier is sat on the ground holding the crying infant. Cosette is a few steps behind, still entranced by the sight of Marius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, M'sieur, come this way. Here's a child that ain't eaten today. Save a life, spare a sou! God rewards all the good that you do. As Valjean bends down to look at Madame Thenardier she recognizes him. MADAME THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a bit! Know that face! (to Monsieur Thenardier)                           Ain't the world a remarkable place! THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Men like me don't forget - You're the bastard who borrowed Cosette! VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this? Are you mad? No, Monsieur, you don't know what you say! Thenardier pulls off his disguise. Valjean recognises him THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know me! I know you! And you'll pay what I'm due. He signals to his gang. A door opens in the alleyway revealing the huge Brujon. The gang move in on Valjean menacingly. EPONINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts from up the                                street)                                           It's the police! Disappear!                            Run for it! It's Javert!                               The gang spill out into the street to find themselves confronted by Javert now with his men. Marius watches, as does Gavroche, drawn by the rumpus. JAVERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another brawl in the square! Another stink in the air! Was there a witness to this? Well, let him speak to Javert! He sees man with his arm protectively round a girl but do not recognize Valjean as Valjean has averted his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAVERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monsieur, these streets are not safe. But let these vermin beware, We'll see that justice is done! He turns back on the Thenardier gang in the passage. JAVERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look upon this fine collection Crawled from underneath a stone. This swarm of worms and maggots Could have picked you to the bone! I know this man over here, I know his name and his trade. And on your witness, m'sieur, I'll see him suitably paid. He turns back to find Valjean and Cosette gone. JAVERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But where's the gentlemen gone? And why on earth did he run? THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will have a job to find him! He's not all he seems to be - And that girl he trails behind him She's the child he stole from me! Marius, equally baffled, goes off in search of them. JAVERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could it be he's that old jailbird That the tide now washes in? Heard my name and started running... All the omens point to him. Thenardier, listening, hears this all with great interest So Valjean is a crook like him. JAVERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the girl who stood beside him, When I turned they both had gone. Could he be the man I've hunted? Could it be he's Jean Valjean? THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the absence of a victim, Dear Inspector, may I go? And remember when you've nicked him It was me what told you so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAVERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Let the old man keep on running I will run him off his feet! (to the crowd) Everyone about your business! (to Gavroche)                                       Clear this garbage off the street! Gavroche is sitting on a horse trough and falls back into when Javert surprises him. He is furious. He sings to Javert's departing back, and t Marius who is close by. GAVROCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That inspector thinks he's something But it's me who runs this town! And my theatre never closes And the curtain's never down! Trust Gavroche! Have no fear! You can always find me here!                            EPONINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosette! Now I remember... Cosette! How can it be? We were children together. Look what's become of me. She turns back to find Marius gazing down the street. MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eponine! Who was that girl? EPONINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That bourgeois two-a-penny thing! MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eponine, find her for me! EPONINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What will you give me? MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything! EPONINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got you all excited now, But God knows what you see in her. Aren't you all delighted now?                           No, I don't want your money, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIUS                                           Eponine, do this for me, Discover where she lives. But careful how you go - Don't let your father know. Eponine! I'm lost until she's found. EPONINE You see? I told you so! There's lots of things I know! Eponine, she knows her way around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE of the Police Headquarters on the Isle de la Cite: a huge bureaucracy. The camera finds Javert standing inside looking out of a door leading onto the roof. As he sings he walks out onto the roof and stands by the symbol of th HQ, a monumental stone eagle. He looks down at the lights reflected in the river below. Then up at the great city. Javert too has a God, and this is his prayer. JAVERT There, out in the darkness A fugitive running Running from God Fallen from grace - God be my witness I never shall yield Till we come face to face - Till we come face to face... He knows his way in the dark Mine is the way of the Lord Those who follow the path of the righteous Shall have their reward And if they fall As Lucifer fell - The flame! The sword! Stars in your multitudes! Scarce to be counted Filling the darkness With order and light - You are the sentinels Silent and sure Keeping watch in the night - Keeping watch in the night... You know your place in the sky You hold your course (more)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAVERT (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your aim And each in your season Returns and returns And is always the same And if you fall As Lucifer fell You fall In flame! And so it must be, and so it is written On the doorway to paradise That those who falter And those who fall Must pay the price! Lord, let me find him That I may see him Safe behind bars! I will never rest till then! This I swear This I swear by the stars! Javert stands silhouetted against the stars, his arms raised up to the night sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marius comes down the street, his mind full of thoughts o Cosette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marius arrives at the first floor front room. Here a grou of students are cleaning rifles and sharing their excitement at the coming revolution: ENJOLRAS, COMBEFERRE COURFEYRAC, JOLY, GRANTAIRE, FEUILLY, PROUVAIRE and other ENJOLRAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Courfeyrac! Do we have all the guns? Joly, Prouvaire! Our time is running short! COURFEYRAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Students, workers, everyone! There's a river on the run! Like the flowing of the tide, Paris is coming to our side! COMBEFERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enjolras! At Notre Dame The sections are prepared!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FEUILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At Rue du Bac They're straining at the leash! ENJOLRAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grantaire, put the bottle down!                     Did we get the guns we need?                        GRANTAIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me brandy on my breath                         And I'll breathe them all to death!                 ENJOLRAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The time is near... So near it's stirring the blood in their veins. And yet beware!                                     Don't let the wine go to your brains. For the army we fight is a dangerous foe With the men and the arms that we never can match. It is easy to sit here and swat them like flies But the National Guard will be harder to catch. We need a sign To rally the people To call them to arms To bring them in line! Joly turns goes over to Marius at the back, a faraway loo on his face. JOLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marius, wake up! What's wrong today? You look as if you've seen a ghost. GRANTAIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some wine, and say what's going on! They sit. MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ghost, you say? A ghost maybe! She was like a ghost to me - One minute there - then she was gone! GRANTAIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am agog! I am aghast! Is Marius in love at last? I've never heard him Ooh and Aah. You talk of battles to be won (more)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRANTAIRE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And here he comes like Don Juan! It is better than an opera! They burst into laughter. But Enjolras isn't smiling. ENJOLRAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is time for us all To decide who we are. Do we fight for the right To a night at the opera now? Have you asked yourselves What's the price you might pay? Is this simply a game For rich young boys to play? The colours of the world Are changing day by day - Red -    the blood of angry men! Black    - the dark of ages past! Red -    a world about to dawn! Black    - the night that ends at last! MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Had you seen her today You might know how it feels To be struck to the bone By a moment of breathless delight! Had you been there today You might also have known How the world may be changed In just one burst of light And what was right seems wrong And what was wrong seems right! GRANTAIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red! MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel my soul on fire! GRANTAIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black! MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My world if she's not there! STUDENTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red! MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The colour of desire! STUDENTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The colour of despair! ENJOLRAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marius, you're no longer a child - I do not doubt you mean it well But now there is a higher call! Who cares about your lonely soul? We strive towards a larger goal - Our little lives don't count at all! ENJOLRAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red!                                                  STUDENTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blood of angry men!                               ENJOLRAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black!                                                STUDENTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dark of ages past!                                Red - a world about to dawn! Black - the night that ends at last!                                                 A scuffle at the door - Gavroche struggling with the barman. Courfeyrac lets him through. GAVROCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen! Listen to me! COURFEYRAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, everybody! GAVROCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General Lamarque is dead! Enjolras turns to his companions. ENJOLRAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lamarque is dead... Lamarque... His death is the hour of fate. The people's man... His death is the sign we await! On his funeral day they will honour his name With the light of rebellion ablaze in their eyes. From their candles of grief we will kindle our flame. On the tomb of Lamarque shall our barricades rise! The time is here! (more)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ENJOLRAS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let us welcome it gladly with courage and cheer! STUDENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let us take to the street with no doubt in our hearts COURFEYRAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But a jubilant shout! LESGLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They will come one and all! STUDENTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They will come when we call! As the students sing, Eponine enters wanting to talk to Marius. Marius sees her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosette is pacing in her bedroom. It's a pretty room, the best room in this small summer house. Her shutters are open, giving a view of a wild unkempt garden. She looks a herself in a mirror, aware of her looks perhaps for the first time. COSETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How strange - This feeling that my life's begun at last! This change - Can people really fall in love so fast? What's the matter with you, Cosette? Have you been too much on your own? So many things unclear - So many things unknown... In my life There are so many questions and answers That somehow seem wrong. In my life There are times when I catch in the silence The sigh of a faraway song And it sings Of a world that I long to see - Out of reach Just a whisper away Waiting for me! Does he know I'm alive? Do I know if he's real? (more)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COSETTE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does he see what I see? Does he feel what I feel? In my life I'm no longer alone - Now the love in my life Is so near... Find me now! Find me here! Valjean knocks and opens her door. He closes her shutters VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear Cosette, You're such a lonely child. How pensive, how sad you seem to me. Believe me, were it within my power I'd fill each passing hour. How quiet it must be, I can see, With only me for company. COSETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's so little I know That I'm longing to know Of the man that you were In a time long ago... There's so little you say Of the life you have known, Why you keep to yourself, Why we're always alone. So dark! So dark and deep, The secrets that you keep! In my life Please forgive what I say You are loving and gentle and good. But papa, dear papa, In your eyes I am still like that child Who was lost in a wood. VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more words - No more words. It's a time that is dead. There are words That are better unheard, Better unsaid. COSETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my life I'm no longer a child and I yearn For the truth that you know Of the years... Years ago!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valjean leaves and goes into his own bedroom. A simple wo shack at the back of the summerhouse, Valjean himself liv with spartan simplicity - he has given the best room to Cosette. Cosette follows. Valjean sits on his bed, his back to Cosette. VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will learn. Truth is given by God To us all in our time, In our turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marius rushes down the street, Eponine following. At the far end is the walled garden behind which lies Valjean's house. MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my life She has burst like the music of angels The light of the sun! And my life seems to stop As if something is over And something has scarcely begun! Eponine, you're the friend Who has brought me here. Thanks to you I am one with the Gods And heaven is near! And I soar through a world that is new, That is free! EPONINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every word that he says Is a dagger in me! In my life There's been no one like him anywhere, Anywhere, where he is If he asked... I'd be his! MARIUS/EPONINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my life There is someone who touches my life - MARIUS (sees Cosette in the                                    garden)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waiting near!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EPONINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waiting here!                                          MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A heart full of love! Cosette sees Marius. She comes up the garden path towards him. She sees Eponine by Marius's side. MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A heart full of song! I'm doing everything all wrong - Oh God, for shame - I do not even know your name. Dear Mad'moiselle, Won't you say? Will you tell? Cosette holds the wrought-ironwork of the gate with both hands, eyes on Marius. Eponine looks on and suffers. Mari wraps his hands round Cosette's. COSETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A heart full of love! No fear, no regret! MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Marius Pontmercy. COSETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And mine's Cosette. MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosette... I don't know what to say - COSETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then make no sound. MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am lost - COSETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am found! MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A heart full of light - COSETTE/MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A night bright as day - MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you must never go away, Cosette - Cosette! COSETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a chain we'll never break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I dream? COSETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm awake. MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A heart full of love - EPONINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was never mine to lose Why regret What could not be? COSETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A heart full of you - EPONINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are words he'll never say Not to me, not to me Not for me! MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A single look and then I knew! COSETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it too! EPONINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His heart full of love... MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From today - EPONINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He will never feel this way. COSETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every day... MARIUS/COSETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For it isn't a dream - Not a dream After all! Valjean comes to the door. VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosette! Cosette!                                    Cosette turns and runs in to the house. Valjean walks down the overgrown garden path to the gate. Marius moves quickly away, instinctively nervous of discovery, and hides behind the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valjean peers into the shadows. He senses that perhaps Cosette has been talking to someone. He looks pensive. Valjean returns inside. Cosette has dropped a keepsake through the gate. Marius p it up. Marius makes his way back down the street, filled with thoughts of his love. Completely forgetting Eponine is th Shadows move up the street from the other direction. It's Thenardier and his gang. They gather at the wrought-iron gate. MONTPARNASSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is his lair! I've seen the old fox around. BABET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He keeps himself to himself He's staying close to the ground. THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I smell profit here! Ten years ago He came and paid for Cosette. I let her go for a song. It's time we settled the debt. This'll cost him dear. BRUJON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I care Who you should rob? Gimme my share! Finish the job! THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shut your mouth! You'll get what's yours! Brujon starts working on the gate lock. He finds Eponine lurking in the shadows. BRUJON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have we here? THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this hussy? BABET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your brat Eponine! Don't you know your own kid? Why's she hanging about here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eponine, get on home! You're not needed in this. We're enough here without you. EPONINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know this house, I tell you! There's nothing here for you! Just the old man and the girl. They live ordinary lives. THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't interfere! You've got some gall! Take care, young miss, You've got a lot to say! BRUJON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's going soft! CLACQUESOUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happens to all! MONTPARNASSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go home, Eponine! Go home, you're in the way! They huddle round the garden gate, which is now broken open. EPONINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna scream! I'm gonna warn them here! THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One little scream and you'll regret it for a year! He goes to the gate and opens it. Eponine screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valjean, now in his own bedroom, hears the scream and tur to the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thenardier and his gang shrink into the shadows, as Eponine's scream ends at last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make for the sewers! Get underground! Leave her to me, Don't wait around! He turns on Eponine and slaps her hard across the face. THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wait, my girl! You'll rue this night!                                    I'll make you scream! You'll scream all right! His men have levered up a grating, and now Thenardier and the gang disappear down into the sewers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valjean comes running into Cosette's room. Valjean takes her in his arms. VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, Cosette! I heard a cry in the dark. I heard the shout of angry voices in the street. COSETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three men I saw beyond the wall... Three men in shadow moving fast! VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a warning to us all! These are the shadows of the past! He moves away to his own bedroom. VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be Javert. He's found my cover at last. I've got to get Cosette away Before he returns. He comes back to Cosette. VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must get away from shadows That will never let us be. Tonight we leave Cosette!                                 COSETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rue de L'Homme Armee. COSETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! No! VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then a ship across the sea. VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry, Cosette! Prepare to leave, And say no more. Tonight we'll away! COSETTE                                          (overlapping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Please no! We can't go! VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry, Cosette! It's time to close another door And live another day! Valjean leaves to start packing. Feverishly, Cosette scribbles a letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosette hurries down the   garden to the gate, and goes t put the folded letter in   the grill where her and Marius hands entwined. Then she   sees Eponine. Eponine steps forward. She thrusts her   letter into her hand. COSETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please give this to Marius! He must know where to find me. She runs back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eponine crumples up the letter. She walks sadly away down the street. Rain is just starting to fall. EPONINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now I'm all alone again - Nowhere to turn, no one to go to. Without a home, without a friend, (more)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EPONINE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without a face to say hello to. The city goes to bed And I can live inside my head. On my own Pretending he's beside me All alone I walk with him till morning Without him I feel his arms around me And when I lose my way I close my eyes And he has found me. She crosses a bridge over the river. EPONINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the rain The pavement shines like silver All the lights Are misty in the river In the darkness the trees are full of starlight And all I see is him and me forever and forever! And I know it's only in my mind - That I'm talking to myself and not to him. And although I know that he is blind, Still I say there's a way for us. I love him But when the night is over He is gone - the river's just a river. Without him the world around me changes - The trees are bare and everywhere The streets are full of strangers. I love him But every day I'm learning All my life I've only been pretending. Without me, his world will go on turning A world that's full of happiness That I have never know. I love him I love him I love him But only on my own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her solitary journey has brought her to the Gorbeau slum. She goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eponine stands outside Marius' door. She opens the letter reads it, then hides it in her pocket. She pushes open Marius' door. Marius looks up. EPONINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came to tell you she's gone. MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gone? What do you mean? EPONINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's gone to England. Marius sets off at a run towards the Rue Plumet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marius finds the gate broken open, sees the house beyond dark and deserted. He pushes in to the garden, up to the house windows, sees the rooms empty within. He stands staring, in shock. Eponine has followed him, and watches him in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valjean and Cosette sit on either side of the carriage, apart, staring out of their respective windows. A stark contrast to the carriage scene when Valjean sang to Coset as a little girl. VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One day more! Another day, another destiny. This never-ending road to Calvary. These men who seem to know my crime Will surely come a second time - One day more!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marius by the empty house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did not live until today - How can I live when we are parted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One day more! COSETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow you'll be worlds away And yet with you my world has started!

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. RUE PLUMET/CARRIAGE
dialogues.text: INTERCUT between Eponine at the gate, Cosette and Valjean in the carriage, and Marius in the dark garden. EPONINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more day all on my own... MARIUS/COSETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will we ever meet again? EPONINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more day with him not caring... MARIUS/COSETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was born to be with you! EPONINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a life I might have known... MARIUS/COSETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I swear I will be true! EPONINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he never saw me there. 80   INT. CAF MUSAIN GROUND & 1ST FLOOR/EXT. RUE DE

dialogues.speaker: CHANVRERIE
dialogues.text: Enjolras and the students have a production line under wa for making bullets. The rifles are now stacked and ready for the uprising. Grantaire is downstairs flirting with a BARMAID. MADAME HUCHELOUP the proprietress of the Cafe Musain is sewing a red revolutionary flag to help the students. ENJOLRAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more day before the storm!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERCUT WITH Marius walking back sadly through the Rue d la Chanvrerie. Eponine follows him at a distance. MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I follow where she goes? ENJOLRAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the barricades of freedom! MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall I join my brothers there? ENJOLRAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When our ranks begin to form - MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I stay and do I dare? ENJOLRAS (from top of stairs, for                               Grantaire's benefit)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you take your place with me? Grantaire rather reluctantly goes upstairs. ALL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The time is now! The day is here! One day more!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Javert is briefing a hundred uniformed police about the coming day in a grand ornate old room at Police Headquarters. JAVERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One day more to revolution. We will nip it in the bud. We'll be ready for these schoolboys. They will wet themselves with blood!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One day more! 83   INT. CAF MUSAIN - GROUND & 1ST FLOOR - NIGHT Monsieur and Madame Thenardier are in the ground-floor ba slyly watching a student smuggling some rifles up the stairs disguised in a piece of cloth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joly takes a tray and collects empty tankards. As he ascends the stairs, Madame Hucheloup tries to get him to give the tankards back. THENARDIERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch'em run amuck! Catch'em as they fall! Never know your luck When there's a free-for-all. Here a little dip, There a little touch - Most of them are goners So they won't miss much! The drinkers in the bar raise their glasses to the studen with their rifles. The students appeal to them. Grantaire is drunk already. Joly starts to melt the tankards in a p to make more bullets. Marius enters the ground floor and takes the red flag from Madame Hucheloup that she has jus finished. The citizens on the ground floor join the students. STUDENTS/CROWD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One day to a new beginning! Raise the flag of freedom high! Every man will be a king! Every man will be a king! There's a new world for the winning! There's a new world to be won! Do you hear the people sing? Marius enters the first floor to join them at last. MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My place is here! I fight with you!

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. RUE DE L'HOMME ARMEE/RUE DE LA CHANVRERIE/C
dialogues.text: MUSAIN GROUND & 1ST FLOOR/POLICE STATION - NIGHT Valjean and Cosette arrive at their new hideout - Marius ties the red flag onto a flagpole - VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One day more! COSETTE/MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did not live until today How can I live when we are parted? Eponine outside the caf, gazing longingly towards Mariu EPONINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more day on my own...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Javert in the police station to his men - JAVERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will join these people's heroes I will follow where they go. I will learn their little secrets, I will know the things they know. VALJEAN/JAVERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One day more! MARIUS/COSETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow you'll be worlds away And yet with you my world has started. JAVERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more day to revolution We will nip it in the bud We'll be ready for these schoolboys - THENARDIERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch'em run amuck Catch'em as they fall Never know your luck When there's a free-for-all! VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow we'll be far away. VALJEAN/JAVERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow is the judgement day. ALL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow we'll discover What our God in heaven has in store - One more dawn! One more day! One day more! We pull back from Enjolras and Marius holding their flag the first floor window with the students beyond them to s that citizens have spilled out of the Cafe Musain into th street and have all joined in the final chorus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All is still. Then comes the soft beating of draped drums The tramp of feet. All down the streets, waiting, the silent faces of the poor. Among them we see Enjolras, Marius, and the radical students.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police and national guardsmen control the growing crowds. Now into view come the leaders of a great FUNERAL PROCESSION. An entire battalion of infantry, marching wit weapons reversed. A column of black-suited dignitaries carrying branches of laurel. A division of Cavalry rides front, behind a section of military drummers who drum a military tatoo. INTO FRAME comes a team of black horses stepping slowly, black plumes nodding, drawing behind them a gun carriage draped in the tricolour flag. On the carriage stands a COFFIN. Softly, in time with the drums, the watching people begin to sing. CROWD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you hear the people sing Singing the song of angry men? It is the music of a people Who will not be slaves again! The police and guardsmen look round to see who is singing so subversively, but they can't be sure where it's coming from. The singing grows stronger. CROWD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the beating of your heart Echoes the beating of the drums There is a life about to start When tomorrow comes! The dignitaries become aware of the singing, and glance uneasily from side to side. CROWD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you join in our crusade? Who will be strong and stand with me?                                                     Beyond the barricade Is there a world you long to see? As the coffin on its carriage draws level with the studen Enjolras suddenly steps out in front of the horses drawin the carriage and waves the red flag, stopping the horses the procession. ENJOLRAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then join in the fight That will give you the right To be free! The students break the ranks of the crowd and surround th coffin carriage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STUDENTS/CROWD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you hear the people sing Singing the song of angry men? It is the music of a people Who will not be slaves again! When the beating of your heart Echoes the beating of the drums There is a life about to start When tomorrow comes! Enjolras, Marius and Courfeyrac and other students climb onto the top of the carriage as the horses and led by Combeferre. ENJOLRAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you give all you can give So that our banner may advance? COURFEYRAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some will fall and some will live Will you stand up and take your chance? ENJOLRAS/MARIUS/COURFEYRAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blood of the martyrs Will water the meadows of France! The crowd supports them and surround the coffin carriage, blocking the attempts of the police to intervene, singing with passion. STUDENTS/CROWD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you hear the people sing Singing the song of angry men? It is the music of a people Who will not be slaves again! When the beating of your heart Echoes the beating of the drums There is a life about to start When tomorrow comes! Enjolras, the students, and the impassioned crowd have no become the procession. They turn off the main street away from the expected course of the funeral procession. Gavroche's elephant looms over this side street. Gavroche and his gang jump down from the elephant to join in. As the procession turns off, the calvary division gallop ahead and disappear round a corner. STUDENTS/CROWD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you join in our crusade? Who will be strong and stand with me? Somewhere beyond the barricade Is there a world you long to see? Do you hear the people sing? (more)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STUDENTS/CROWD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, do you hear the distant drums? It is the future that we bring When tomorrow comes! The students and crowd come face to face with the calvary one side, muskets of the infantry poke through the broken down fence surrounding the elephant. Other infantry have taken up position in a cafe opposite, upending tables to provide cover. There is a tense, prolonged silence. Then suddenly one nervous SOLDIER lets off a round. It hits a middle aged kindly looking WOMAN CITIZEN in the crowd around the coff carriage. The crowd is furious. Students charge the soldi grab his musket and knock him down with the hilt of the g More shots ring out. The cavalry charges. The funeral explodes into a riot. The people of Paris turn on the dragoons, the National Guards, the police. More squadrons of dragoons charge into the crowd, sabres unsheathed. Wom run screaming in terror. ENJOLRAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the barricades! STUDENTS/CROWD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the barricades! To arms! To arms! Some students fire weapons into the air, some into the cavalry and at the infantry. Enjolras knocks a calvary officer off his horse and Marius jumps on the horse. The students break away and race off through the cafe int a side street where citizens begin to erect a barricade. cavalry rider gives chase and is shot by one of the students and falls through the window of an upended carriage. The students, with Marius on horseback, race to the slums.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOLLOW the students as they burst into their home street. They have been joined by a motley collection of citizens including burghers and an old eccentric man FATHER MABEUF who works as hard as anyone. They raid a fencing shop and gun shop for weapons, they force wives to give up their husbands' muskets and chalk up the debt to the revolution on their front doors, they encourage homeowners to contribute furniture sometimes appearing at high windows help overcome any reluctance. Soon the street is raining tables, chairs, mattresses, sofas. They smash streetlamps They set to work to build their barricade. Students commandeer an omnibus which is overturned to form the barricade's heart. Three students arrive in the street hauling an uprooted tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pull up paving stones, rip boards, timbers and front doors from house and shop-fronts, pull down buttresses, a raid the Cafe Musain, systematically stripping it of ever item of furniture despite the lamentations and protestations of Madame Hucheloup and her barmaid. As the barricade rises they bring down from the first flo of the cafe the rifles and ammunition they've gathered, t prepare to defend their chosen ground. A student stands o a stone post distributing weapons. They line the first an second floor front rooms with paving stones to create protected shooting positions. The inside of the barricade is built neatly with steps up made from paving stones. Th outside is a crazy knarled mess. ENJOLRAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here upon these stones We will build our barricade. In the heart of the city We claim as our own Each man to his duty And don't be afraid. A man in worker's clothing is helping build the growing barricade,. He wears the insignia of the rebels, and keep his head down. ENJOLRAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! I will need a report On the strength of the foe. The man who's just arrived looks up. It's Javert. JAVERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can find out the truth! I know their ways, Fought their wars, Served my time In the days Of my youth. He slips away through the barricade, which is still risin PROUVAIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See! The people unite! GRANTAIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pray your right COMBEFERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dogs will bark! GAVROCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fleas will bite! LESGLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They will do what is right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The barricade is now complete: an impressive wall up to twelve feet high, with one heavily guarded section that c be wheeled open to allow access. Two smaller barricades protect the left and right side of the cafe. Enjolras climbs halfway up the main barricade and turns to his little army. Grantaire prises the final piece of Madame Hucheloup's furniture from her arms - her favourite sewin armchair - and adds it to the barricade. As the men sing she steals it back defiantly. ENJOLRAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red, the blood of angry men! ALL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black, the dark of ages past! Red, a world about to dawn! Black, the night that ends at last!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is night. The students have been waiting for hours. A single flaming torch atop the barricade caged in by cob underlights a fluttering red flag. There is no sign yet of any opposition. A boy climbs down from sentry duty on the barricade. Mari realizes its Eponine. She sits down with her back to him. MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, little boy, what's this I see?                       God Eponine the things you do!                            EPONINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know this is no place for me,                           Still I would rather be with you!                         MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out before the trouble                                starts!                                                   Get out, `Ponine, you might get                           shot!                                                     EPONINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got you worried now, I have!                         That shows you like me quite a                            lot...                                                    MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get Out!                                                  Joly, sentry on the main barricade, sees a figure approac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's back! Javert, still in his disguise as a rebel, is let back through the guarded `gate' into the barricaded street. JAVERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, my friends, I have done as I said. I have been to their lines, I have counted each man. I will tell what I can. Better be warned They have armies to spare And our danger is real - We will need all our cunning To bring them to heel. ENJOLRAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have faith! If you know what their movements are We'll spoil their game. There are ways that a people can fight - We shall overcome their power! JAVERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have overheard their plans. There will be no attack tonight. They intend to starve you out Before they start a proper fight - Concentrate their force, Hit us when it's light - GAVROCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liar! They all look up. There's Gavroche, on the top of the barricade. GAVROCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening, dear Inspector. Lovely evening, my dear! I know this man, my friends. His name's Inspector Javert! So don't believe a word he says Cause none of it's true. This only goes to show What little people can do.                             Guns swing round to aim at Javert. He stares back in defiance. Gavroche comes dancing down the barricade to Courfeyrac's delighted embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COURFEYRAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bravo, little Gavroche! You're the top of the class! Gavroche grabs Grantaire's red cap and puts it on his own head, mimicking the students. PROUVAIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are we going to do With this snake in the grass? Enjolras faces Javert. ENJOLRAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tie this man and take him To the tavern in there! The people will decide your fate, Inspector Javert! JAVERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot me now or shoot me later - Every schoolboy to his sport! Death to each and every traitor! I renounce your people's court! ENJOLRAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take this man. Bring him through. There is work we have to do. Javert is led into the cafe. As they pass through the fro door only one student is holding Javert. Seizing his opportunity, Javert breaks free and the students have to subdue him by force. Javert is on his knees and is being to the staircase. ENJOLRAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When are they coming!?                                  Silence. Suddenly, out of the darkness, the students and citizens the barricade here an ominous distant sound. The sound of marching feet, hundreds of men, marching in unison. First soft, then building louder and louder, closer and closer. Boots on cobbles. The sound comes right into the end of t street. Enjolras and all the students man the main barricade. Silence. They peer over the barricade. In the pitch blackness, all they can make out is hundreds of gossamer thin slivers. T are bayonets and musket barrels dimly lit by the reflecti from the torch. A voice shouts out from the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARMY OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's there? At the same time we hear the clatter of guns being levell ENJOLRAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: French Revolution. ARMY OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire! A flash turns all the facades of the street bright crimso though the door of a furnace has suddenly open and shut. A dreadful explosion bursts over the barricade. The red f falls, the pole sliced through. Bullets richochet off the cornices of the houses, bore into the barricade and wound several men. ENJOLRAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as students return fire)                            Comrades, do not fire back! Do not                       waste powder!                                            In the darkness, the clang of ramrods in muskets - the tr reloading weapons. Enjolras picks up the fallen flag and is about to take it when the old man Father Mabeuf who has seen many insurrections before this takes the flag and runs up onto top of the barricade. ARMY OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's there? Get down! MABEUF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vive la France! ARMY OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire! A second volley. Father Mabeuf falls down dead. While everyone is reacting the dead old man and the wounded, the men are distracted noticing that some French soldiers have used the cover of darkness to creep down the street. All at once the FIRST FULL ATTACK begins. Shouts and the rattle of gunfire as SOLDIERS throw themselves up and ove the barricade. The students run for their guns and return fire. They are taken by surprise. All could be lost in th first instant. Some soldiers make it up to the top of the barricade, where they're driven back by the fierce resistance of the defenders. Eponine sees one soldier aiming his rifle at Marius - she throws herself in front Marius just as the rifle fires - and Marius is safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are being   overrun. Panic ensues. The gun battle is fierce. Marius   in a flash of inspiration realises all i unless they do   something. He drags a barrel of gunpowde the top of the   barricade, grabs the torch and with a fa deadly resolve   he tips the torch towards the barrel. MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear out or I'll blow up the barricade! Everyone freezes. ARMY OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blow it up then and take yourself with it! MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And myself with it! Marius brings the torch closer to the powder keg. But already the soldiers have cleared out. Marius comes down from the barricade. FEUILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Marius)                                          Thank you!                                               LESGLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you thinking!                                  As everyone surrounds Marius in amazement he spots Eponin lying propped against the barricade. MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eponine! What have you done? He kneels by her side. Eponine is dying. EPONINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here... It's from Cosette... I kept it from you... With a struggle she pulls the letter out of her pocket, a pushes it into his hand. EPONINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be too hard on me... Marius is shocked to find blood pouring from her wound. MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eponine, you're hurt! You need some help! Rain begins to fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EPONINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you fret, M'sieur Marius - I don't feel any pain. A little fall of rain Can hardly hurt me now. You're here - that's all I need to know And you will keep me safe And you will keep me close And rain will make the flowers grow... MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you will live, Eponine - Dear God above! If I could close your wounds with words of love - EPONINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hold me now, and let it be. Shelter me... Comfort me... MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will live a hundred years If I could show you how... I won't desert you now... EPONINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain can't hurt me now... This rain will wash away what's past And you will keep me safe And you will keep me close I'll sleep in your embrace at last. Marius tries to comfort Eponine in his arms.            MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hush-a-bye, dear Eponine You won't feel any pain A little fall of rain Can hardly hurt you now I'm here. EPONINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So don't you fret, M'sieur Marius I don't feel any pain A little fall of rain Can hardly hurt me now... MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will stay with you Till you are sleeping. EPONINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all I need to know And you will keep me safe (more)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EPONINE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you will keep me close And rain.. Will make the flowers... Grow... Eponine dies in Marius's arms. Marius looks up at the others, his eyes full of tears. ENJOLRAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were the first to fall. The first to fall upon this barricade. MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her name was Eponine! Her life was cold and dark, yet she was unafraid! COMBEFERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We fight here in her name... PROUVAIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She will not die in vain... LESGLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She will not be betrayed... They pick up Eponine's body and carry her into the tavern COURFEYRAC                                       (to Gavroche)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright? GAVROCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was my sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marius reads the letter Eponine has given him. He takes o pencil and paper and writes a note. Looking round, he see Gavroche. MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gavroche! Do you know the Rue de l'Homme Arm? GAVROCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Course I do! MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you take this for me? He holds out his note.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LANDLADY climbs the stairs, followed by Gavroche. The landlady indicates the door, and Gavroche knocks boldly. The door opens a crack to reveal a cautious Valjean. GAVROCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letter for Cosette. VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take it. Gavroche holds out the letter with one hand, not quite giving it, the other hand open for a tip. Valjean gives him a coin, which he pockets as he hands ov the letter. GAVROCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something for you, something for me. Who needs charity?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON VALJEAN - As he reads the note. VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Dearest Cosette, you have entered my soul And soon you will be gone. Can it be only a day since we met And the world was reborn? If I should fall in the battle to come Let this be my goodbye. Now that I know you love me as well It is harder to die. I pray that God will bring me home To be with you. Pray for your Marius. He prays for you.' He looks up, deeply distressed. He can't bear the thought of losing Cosette. VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They haven't got a chance, these boys They almost certainly will die She'll be alone And she will need me all the more And we will go on as before                               When he is gone I dare not think like this I must find this boy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valjean walks the streets, not caring where he goes, struggling with his tormented thoughts. He sees a barrica being dismantled. And bodies. Suddenly he knows what he's going to do. He sees a dead soldier. He takes his jacket and swiftly pulls it on. He continues on his way in the dark. Looking up he sees that he's been walking all the time towards the very barricade where Marius waits. Now looking like a soldier, he passes unchallenged throug their lines, and into the shadows. As he passes, he notices two soldiers climbing up onto th rooftops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glimpses through the barricade of a lone figure approachi from the far end of the narrow street. The figure comes into lamp light. It's Valjean, in the soldier's jacket. The student sentries level their guns. Gavroche jumps up. VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't shoot! JOLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here comes a man in uniform! What brings you to this place? VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I come here as a volunteer. JOLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Approach and show your face! PROUVAIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wear an army uniform. VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why they let me through. The student sentries open the slot in the barricade to le Valjean enter. JOLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got some years behind you, sir. VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's much that I can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see that prisoner over there? He points to Javert, in a dark corner, his hands tied. GRANTAIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A volunteer like you! COMBEFERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A spy who calls himself Javert! GRANTAIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going to get it too!                               Javert looks up and meets Valjean's eyes. A steady shared look. GAVROCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't shoot! I know him! He's no                        soldier!                                                Suddenly Valjean spots a couple of snipers creeping over roofs to gain an angle of attack on them. They are aiming Enjolras. Swiftly Valjean grabs a gun and shoots up at th sending them scattering.
