Quickly other students join in a the snipers are driven back. There is a burst of gunfire from both ends of the street brief fire fight ensues. The snipers have disappeared. Enjolras turns to Valjean. ENJOLRAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For your presence of mind, For the deed you have done, I will thank you, M'sieur, When our battle is won. MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, M'sieur. VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me no thanks, M'sieur. There's something you can do. ENJOLRAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it is in my power. VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the spy Javert! Let me take care of him. Javert hears this with grim satisfaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAVERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The law is inside out. The world is upside down. ENJOLRAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what you have to do - The man belongs to you. He turns to his little army. ENJOLRAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The enemy may be regrouping! Hold yourselves in readiness! Come, my friends, back to your positions! The dawn is breaking fast. Valjean takes Javert out the back of the Cafe Musain. He carries a knife. VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We meet again... JAVERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've hungered for this all your life. Take your revenge. How right you should kill with a knife. Valjean uses the knife to cut Javert free. VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You talk too much. Your life is safe in my hands. JAVERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't understand... VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here. JAVERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valjean, take care! I'm warning you. VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear out of here! JAVERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once a thief, forever a thief. What you want, you always steal. You would trade your life for mine. Yes, Valjean, you want a deal! Shoot me now for all I care - If you let me go, beware! You'll still answer to Javert!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are wrong, and always have been wrong. I'm a man no worse than any man. You are free, and there are no conditions - No bargains or petitions. There's nothing that I blame you for. You've done your duty, nothing more. No doubt our paths will cross again. He raises his gun and points it at Javert. VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go! As Javert goes, he raises the gun barrel and fires a sing shot into the air. ENJOLRAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Courfeyrac, you take the watch - They may attack before it's light. Everybody keep the faith, For certain as our banner flies, We are not alone - The people too must rise! Marius is manically working to raise the height of one of smaller barricades. ENJOLRAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marius, rest. Grantaire drunkenly starts singing a drinking song and it taken up more seriously by Feuilly. Bottles are passed ro GRANTAIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink with me to days gone by!                         FEUILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sing with me the songs we knew! PROUVAIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's to pretty girls Who went to our heads! JOLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's to witty girls Who went to our beds!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STUDENTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's to them - (Marius sings to Valjean)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And here's to you! GRANTAIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink with me to days gone by! Can it be you fear to die? Will the world remember you when you fall? Can it be your death Means nothing at all? Is your life just one more lie? Grantaire glares at Enjolras and enters the cafe. ALL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink with me To days gone by! To the life That used to be! At the shrine of friendship Never say die... Let the wine of friendship Never run dry! Here's to you And here's to me! Valjean is moving through the cafe when he hears Marius through a window. He moves to the window. Marius sits ben it. MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I care if I should die Now she goes across the sea? Life without Cosette Means nothing at all.. Please don't weep, Cosette, Should Marius fall. Will you weep, Cosette, For me? Valjean listens to Marius's song, and he's moved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look-outs keep watch at either end of the barricaded street. Many of the rest of the rebels are sleeping. Valjean paces, unable to sleep, inside the cafe. Dead bodies are lined up on the ground floor. He comes to a stop, and gazes on Marius as he sleeps through the window VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God on high Hear my prayer (more)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VALJEAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my need You have always been there. He is young He's afraid Let him rest Heaven blessed. Bring him home Bring him home Bring him home! He's like the son I might have known If God had granted me a son. The summers die One by one How soon they fly On and on And I am old And will be gone. Bring him peace Bring him joy He is young He is only a boy. You can take You can give Let him be Let him live, If I die, let me die Let him live Bring him home Bring him home Bring him home! Valjean is now kneeling next to the sleeping Marius. CRANE UP AND UP - Seeing the little world of the barricad street now surrounded by waiting soldiers - and the stree round them packed with soldiers in their thousands, so ma that we know the little band can never win. CRANE UP AND UP until the barricade and the army that entraps it has become a small pool of darkness in the centre of the bright lights of Paris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun still below the rooftops. Every house is tightly shuttered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grantaire is fast asleep in the upstairs room, dead drunk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enjolras re-enters the barricade through the secret gate. He has been on a reconnaissance. He looks at the street. one is stirring, but for a single shutter which opens a crack - a face peeps - and it closes again. Below him the students are up and getting ready. ENJOLRAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The people have not stirred. COURFEYRAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yet we will not abandon those                            Who still live in fear. ENJOLRAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The people have not heard, Yet we will not abandon those who cannot hear. Let us not waste lives! Let all who wish to                                      Go from here! There is silence. Uncertainty. Yet no one moves to go. GAVROCHE                                       (from top of barricade)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you hear the people sing                              GAVROCHE/COURFEYRAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Singing the song of angry men                            STUDENTS/CITIZENS                              (joining)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is the music of the people                            Who will not be slaves again                             When the beating of your heart                           Echoes the beating of the drums                          There is a life about to start                           When tomorrow comes!                                     Under this:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FEUILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enjolras! Ammunition's short.                            MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will go into the streets. There are bodies all around. Ammunition to be had. Lots of bullets to be found. ENJOLRAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't let you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me go! He's no more than a boy. I am old. I have nothing to fear. Gavroche is already climbing the barricade under cover of the smoke. GAVROCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I volunteer! COURFEYRAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come back, Gavroche! Don't you dare! JOLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone pull him down right now! GAVROCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at me, I'm almost there! GAVROCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little people know When little people fight We may look easy pickings But we've got some bite! So never kick a dog When he's just a pup - We'll fight like twenty armies And we won't give up! The rays of the rising sun break through, lighting up Gavroche. GAVROCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you'd better run for cover When the pup grows - Crack! A musket shot. Gavroche falls face down onto the barricade. COURFEYRAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No-o! He runs up the barricade, seizes Gavroche's body in his arms, convulsed with grief, and brings it back through th gate in the barricade. At the other end of the street Javert has appeared. He se this gate. And talks to the Army Officer. As the smoke from the muskets clears horses are revealed drawing field artillery into position. The Army Officer i lining up the big guns carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARMY OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You at the barricades listen to this! The people of Paris sleep in their beds! You have no chance, No chance at all! Why throw your lives away? Enjolras gazes on his pitifully small group. ENJOLRAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let us die facing our foes! Make them bleed while we can! COMBEFERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make'em pay through the nose! COURFEYRAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make'em pay for every man! ENJOLRAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let others rise to take our place Until the earth is free! The sun now appears above the rooftops of the city. And the big guns fire - BOOM! BOOM! BOOM! The bombardment hits the barricade, rocking it. In its wa a massive barrage of musket fire. The big gun has been lined up with the gate and has burst right through in the first hit. Bullets fly, and every few moments another cannon ball smashes into the piled debris. Javert is glimpsed among t attackers. Enjolras and the students throw themselves onto the barricades, firing at the attackers, handing their rifles down to others to be re-loaded, firing again. Valjean moves among them, tending to the wounded, lifting down the dead, regardless of his own safety. Marius takes a bullet, and crumples and falls. Valjean ru towards him - CRASH! The latest cannonade bursts a hole in the barricad and now the soldiers are storming through. The hard core student fighters retreat, firing as they go, into the Caf Musain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Students and soldiers fight in the caf, on the stairs, the stairs to the upper room. Students driving back the pursuing soldiers hack away at the staircase, smashing it to fragments - the soldiers below fire up at them - students fall, their bodies caught on the jagged remnants of the stairs. Grantaire is still unconscious from drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valjean has Marius in his arms and is hiding him from the onrush of the soldiers -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The students' ammunition has run out, they're hurling sticks and bottles - but the soldiers have found a way to clamber up, shooting as they come, and one by one the students are falling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valjean carries Marius away from the carnage. A soldier challenges him. One violent blow from Valjean sends the soldier flying -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldiers break through at last to the upper room, to there's only Enjolras still alive. He stands by the windo knowing he will die now, proud and unafraid. Seeing him t soldiers hesitate. The sudden silence wakes Grantaire fro his drunken slumber. GRANTAIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long live the republic! He sees Enjolras with the muskets raised against him. Grantaire goes and joins him. Enjolras smiles, and raises now-ragged red flag. The rifles blaze. Grantaire drops back to the ground. Enjolras falls back -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enjolras falling backwards out of the window, until he hangs upside down, the red flag still in his hands, streaming like blood down the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK to see the street littered with corpses, and th remains of the barricade, and soldiers scouring the rubbl for any last pockets of resistance. BACK AND BACK to come to a stop looking at the wide scene INTO FRAME walks Javert, grimly surveying the victory of law over rebellion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valjean carries Marius down a long narrow alley that runs between the backs of tall houses. The alley turns a corne and there ahead is a dead end. Behind him, the stamp of soldiers' boots. Ahead, no way out. Then his searching gaze falls on an iron grating in the ground. A storm drain. ON THE SOLDIERS - As they come round the corner into the end of the alley. They look round. It's empty. SOLDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing here! The soldiers depart. A moment of silence. Then into the alley's end steps Javert. Not so easily fooled. He walks all the way to the end, and looks round. He sees the drain at his feet. He sees the signs that the grating has been lifted. He stoops, and tries to lift it. It's far too heavy for him. He straightens up and looks round, calculating. Where doe the drain lead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valjean is pulling Marius after him down a tight sloping pipe, where dark water races. Suddenly they start to slid then drop through a vent into a wide sewage tunnel. Faint light reflecting off the slime of curving tunnel walls. T skitter of rats. Sodden forms floating by: dead bodies. Valjean carries Marius down the tunnel, moving as fast as he can, losing strength all the time. He reaches an intersection where four sewers meet. Light falls through distant gratings. One of the four sewers is dry. Here he lets his burden down, and himself sinks to the slimy grou to rest. He lets his eyes close. A voice echoes in the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's a hint of gold Stuck into a tooth - Pardon me, m'sieur, You won't be needing it no more. Shouldn't be too hard to sell. A figure coming closer. A sewer thief, robbing corpses. N sign of life in either Valjean or Marius. THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, someone's got to clean'em up, my friends, Before the little harvest Disappears into the mud. Someone's got to collect their odds and ends When the gutters run with blood. Now we see the thief is Thenardier. He finds a ring on Marius's finger and pulls it off. THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's a tasty ring Pretty little thing Heart's no longer going And he's lived his little time, But his watch is ticking yet. It's a world where the dog eats the dog. Where they kill for the bones in the street. And God in his heaven, He don't interfere Cos he's dead as the stiff at my feet! I raise my eyes to see the heavens And only the moon looks down. The harvest moon shines down! Valjean wakes, rears up, seizes Thenardier by the arm, slams him against the sewer wall. VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I get out of here? THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There! That way! Valjean drops him, picks Marius up once more, and sets of Thenardier stares after them, grinning. He's sent then th wrong way. LATER - Valjean in the sewers, Marius on his back, and they're sinking ever deeper into the slimy water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he feels himself sink, Valjean holds Marius up in his arms and forges on, chest deep, lifting the younger man above his head. Still he sinks, until his face is half- submerged and he's gagging in the filth. He stumbles, and suddenly he's sunk beneath the surface, and Marius is dropping - Then up he bursts again, face black with slime, eyes burning with his refusal to be beaten. LATER - Valjean staggers down the endless sewers, Marius his back. But all the time he can hear, closer now, the rushing sound of the river. Round a bend and at last - moonlight ahead. He drags himself on through the shallow running water towards the moonlight. He reaches the exit at last. Before him the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valjean, crusted with slime, heaves Marius out of the sew onto the embankment that runs beside the river. He looks up. There, staring at him, is Javert. Valjean rises slowly. Heaves Marius up onto his back once more. The strain of the night is showing. He's a man near the end of his strength. VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's you, Javert! I knew you wouldn't wait too long. The faithful servant at his post once more. This man's done no wrong. And he needs his family's care. JAVERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I warned you I would not give in! I won't be swayed! VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another hour yet And then I'm yours And all our debts are paid. JAVERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man of mercy comes again And talks of justice!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come, time is running short - Look down, Javert! He's standing in his grave! He starts to move past Javert. Javert draws his pistol and holds it to Valjean's head. JAVERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more step and you die. Valjean meets his eyes. That old battle of will against will. VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I die. He starts walking past Javert. Javert's hand trembles as holds the pistol. Valjean keeps walking. Javert wills himself to shoot, but he just can't do it. Frustrated, enraged with himself, he lowers the gun. JAVERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take him, Valjean, Before I change my mind! I will be waiting...
He turns away, trembling now all up and down his body. He stares into the river. Valjean is gone now. He's alone. JAVERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this man? What sort of devil is he? To have caught me in a trap And choose to let me go free? It was his hour at last To put a seal on my fate Wipe out the past And wash me clean off the slate! All it would take Was a flick of his knife Vengeance was his And he gave me back my life! He begins to move away along the embankment, up steps, towards a bridge. He's unaware of everything except the turmoil in his brain. JAVERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damned if I live in the debt of a thief! Damned if I yield at the end of the chase! (more)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAVERT (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am the law and the law is not mocked! I'll spit his pity right back in his face! There is nothing on earth that we share! It is either Valjean or Javert! How can I allow this man To hold dominion over me? This desperate man that I have hunted... He gave me my life! He gave me freedom! I should have perished by his hand It was his right... It was my right to die as well... Instead I live... But live in hell! He moves up from the embankment onto the bridge. Here he stands, looking down at the dark water of the night river The Seine forms a whirlpool here, where violent currents swirl round the piles of the bridge. JAVERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And my thoughts fly apart Can this man be believed? Shall his sins be forgiven? Shall his crimes be reprieved? And must I now begin to doubt Who never doubted all those years? My heart is stone and still it trembles... The world I have known is lost in shadow Is he from heaven or from hell? And does he know That granting me my life today This man has killed me even so? He climbs up onto the parapet, reaching his arms up to th night sky. JAVERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am reaching but I fall And the stars are black and cold As I stare into the void Of a world that cannot hold... I'll escape now from that world From the world of Jean Valjean This is nowhere I can turn... There is no way to go on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches higher, turning his body, twisting, as if he wants some angel from on high to save him - and so, turning, he falls into the river. The swirling eddies clo over him. And he's lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soldiers are dismantling the last of the barricade. Women move about the street, seeking their dead loved ones amon the bodies that still litter the barricade. These are bot the middle-class mothers of the students - Enjolras's mother, Grantaire's sister - and the working women of the slums for whom they died, united now in their grief. WOMAN 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see them Going off to fight? WOMAN 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Children of the barricade Who didn't last the night. WOMAN 3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see them Lying where they died? Someone used to cradle them And kiss them when they cried. WOMAN 4

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see them lying side by side? WOMAN 5

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who will wake them? WOMAN 6

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one ever will. WOMAN 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one ever told them that A summer day can kill. WOMAN 7

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were schoolboys Never held a gun Fighting for a new world that Would rise up like the sun. WOMAN 3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's that new world Now the fighting's done? The women move off to go about their day's business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON MARIUS - He's waking from the nightmare, finding himself in a fine bed, with clean linen. He looks round: handsome room. GILLENORMAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marius! You've come back to us! Marius recognises the old man anxiously watching him: his grandfather, Monsieur GILLENORMAND. MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandfather... He struggles to rise, but he lacks the strength. His grandfather's face shows only love and concern. GILLENORMAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rest, Marius. No more harsh words between us. I just thank God you're alive. Timidly the old man comes closer to the bed. Tears form i Marius's eyes. Encouraged, the old man takes Marius's han in his. GILLENORMAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've come home. To all of us. The distant voices of the mourning women - WOMEN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Round and round And back where you began...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marius makes his way slowly up the stairs to the upper room. He's still weak from his wounds. He enters the room where his friends died, and looks round. He sinks into a chair. MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a grief that can't be spoken There's a pain goes on and on Empty chairs at empty tables Now my friends are dead and gone. He sees the bloodstain on the wall beneath the window sil The blood of Enjolras. MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here they talked of revolution Here it was they lit the flame Here they sang about tomorrow (more)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIUS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And tomorrow never came... From the table in the corner They could see a world reborn And they rose with voices ringing And I can hear them now! The very words that they had sung Became their last communion On the lonely barricade at dawn. He looks out of the window at what's left of the barricad He seems to see again the brave doomed defence, the smoke and the gunfire, the young men falling. MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my friends, my friends, forgive me That I live and you are gone There's a grief that can't be spoken There's a pain goes on and on... Phantom faces at the window Phantom shadows on the floor Empty chairs at empty tables Where my friends will meet no more. Oh my friends, my friends, don't ask me What your sacrifice was for Empty chairs at empty tables Where my friends will sing no more. Slowly he rises from the chair and turns to the doorway. There stands Cosette, waiting for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosette holds Marius, supporting him, as he enters the house. COSETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every day You walk with stronger step, You walk with longer step. The worst is over. MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every day I wonder every day Who it was brought me here From the barricade. Cosette leads him into the room where Valjean and Gillenormand wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COSETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't think about it, Marius! With all the years ahead of us! I will never go away And we will be together Every day. Every day We'll remember that night And the vow that we made. As Valjean and Gillenormand look on, Marius and Cosette sing their love to each other. COSETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A heart full of love A night full of you The words are old But always true. VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was never mine to keep She is youthful, she is free... MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosette, Cosette! COSETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw you waiting and I knew - GILLENORMAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God, thank God you are here! Thank God, thank God you are home! MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waiting for you! At your feet! COSETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At your call! VALJEAN/GILLENORMAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love is the garden of the young Let it be Let it be! A heart full of love This I give you this day. MARIUS/COSETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it wasn't a dream Not a dream after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marius stands before Valjean, alone in this more private room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M'sieur, this is a day I never can forget. Is gratitude enough For giving me Cosette? Your home shall be with us And not a day shall pass But we will prove our love To you, whom we shall call A father to us both, A father to us all. VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not another word, my son. There's something now that must be done... He's prepared himself to make this confession, but it's still hard. VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There lived a man whose name was Jean Valjean. He stole some bread to save his sister's son For nineteen winters served his time In sweat he washed away his crime. Marius hears this with shock. VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Years ago, He broke parole and lived a life apart... How could he tell Cosette and break her heart? It's for Cosette this must be faced: If he is caught, she is disgraced... The time has come to journey on, And from this day he must be gone! Who am I? Who am I? MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Jean Valjean! Marius can't conceal that he's disturbed by this revelation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monsieur, you cannot leave! Whatever I tell my beloved Cosette She will never believe me. VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make her believe I have gone on a journey A long way away. Tell her my heart was too full for farewells - It is better this way. Promise me, Monsieur, Cosette will never know... MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I give my word. VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...What I have spoken, why I must go. MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the sake of Cosette, it must be so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A waiting cab. Valjean comes out of the modest lodging house and gets in. The cab rattles away down the street. IN THE CAB - Valjean sits gazing far away at nothing. The his weary eyes close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosette gazes at Marius, bewildered by what she has just learned. COSETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's he gone without a word That wouldn't be his way to go MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All he asked for me to   say He's on a journey, far   away. Dear Cosette, he loves   you so Perhaps he will return   some day. Cosette comes into Marius's arms, tears in her eyes. COSETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't leave us now What's our wedding day Without him giving me away? "LES MISERABLES" BLUE REVISIONS 20.5.2012          119.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marius and Cosette, newly married, are walking towards Marius' house through an aisle created by wedding guests. Carriages line the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ring out the bells Upon this day of days! May all the angels Of the Lord above In jubilation Sing their songs of praise! And crown this blessed time With peace and love!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waltz music plays as Marius and Cosette lead the dancing the wedding reception. As the dance proceeds, two extraordinary figures enter, a start helping themselves to the drink and the food. They are Thenardier and his wife, dressed up for high society.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Baron and Baroness du Thenard

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look round as the dance continues, highly satisfied themselves and see Marius. Thenardier makes a mock-formal bow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forget where we met... Was it not at the Chateau Lafarge Where the Duke did that Puke Down the Duchess's decolletage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, `Baron du Thenard', The circles I move in are humbler by far... Go away, Thenardier! Do you think I don't know who you are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not fooled! Told you so! Show M'Sieur what you've come here to show. Tell the boy what you know!

dialogues.speaker: "LES MISERABLES" BLUE REVISIONS 20.5.2012 119A.
dialogues.text: THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pity to disturb you at a feast like this But 500 francs surely wouldn't come amiss. MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In God's name say what you have to say. MADAME THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Thenardier) He speaks.                                              (to Marius) You pay! THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I saw, clear as light,                             Jean Valjean in the sewers that                         night,                                                  Had this corpse on his back                             Some boy he'd killed in a viscious                      attack.                                                 I was there, never fear!                                Even found me this fine souvenir!                       He shows off his ring. Marius stares in astonishment. MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know this! This was mine!                             This is surely some heavenly sign!                      Thenardier steals the ring back. THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there's more! Mark this well -                      It was the night that the                               barricades fell.                                        MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then it's true! Then I'm right!                         Jean Valjean was my saviour that                        night!                                                  Thenardier looks past Marius to where Cosette stands amon their friends. He lowers his voice. THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean Valjean - the old con.                             You pay up and I'll say where he's                      gone.                                                   He takes out money and reluctantly presses it into Thenardier's hands. Madame Thenardier takes the money bef Thenardier has safely pocketed it. "LES MISERABLES" BLUE REVISIONS 20.5.2012          120. MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so loud! Here's for you. God forgive us the things that we do. MADAME THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's about some extra On a day so glad Our little orphan girl She hasn't done so bad.                                Raised in a convent Cash to spare -                                        We want our share. Marius hands over yet more money to Madame Thenardier. THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite the little nun, ain't she!                       CRACK! Thenardier sinks to the ground, felled by a powerf blow from an angered Marius. The band stops playing. MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?                                           THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cowardly voice)                                       The convent.                                           Marius rushes to Cosette and we see him telling her where Valjean is. They hurry away. Thenardier clambers to his feet, helped by his wife. He gestures to the band to continue. They stand by the tiere wedding cake. As Thenardier recovers his composure, Madam Thenardier steals one then two pillars from the cake so i collapses on the floor. She then pushes it under the tabl with her foot. "LES MISERABLES" BLUE REVISIONS 20.5.2012            121.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't it a laugh? Ain't it a treat? Hob-nobbin' here Among the elite? Here comes a prince There goes a Jew This one's a queer But what can you do?                                    (pulling Madame Thenardier                          onto the dance floor)                              Paris at my feet! Paris in the dust! And here's me breaking bread With the upper crust - As he pivots Madame Thenardier, stolen silver drops out f Madame Thenardier's dress. The music stops dead in the clatter. The Thenardiers look up, as if implying that the silver dropped from the ceiling. The dance continues. Monsieur Gillenormand motions to the Majordomo to remove these unwanted guests. THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beggar at the feast!                                    Master of the dance! Life is easy pickings If you grab your chance! MADAME THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everywhere you go                                       Law-abiding folk Doing what is decent THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they're mostly broke!                               MADAME THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Singing to the Lord on Sundays THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Praying for the gifts he'll send -                      THENARDIER/MADAME THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we're the ones who take it - We're the ones who make it in the end! The Thenardiers are carried off, singing as they go. THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch the buggers dance                                 MADAME THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch'em till they drop!

dialogues.speaker: "LES MISERABLES" BLUE REVISIONS 20.5.2012 121A
dialogues.text: THENARDIER/MADAME THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your wits about you And you stand on top! THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Masters of the land                                    MADAME THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always get our share                                   THENARDIER/MADAME THENARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear away the barricades                              And we're still there!                                 We know where the wind is blowing                      Money is the stuff we smell -                          And when we're rich as Croesus,                        Jesus! Won't we see you all in                         hell!                                                  As they are thrown out, the Thenardiers steal a tiara and candlestick. "LES MISERABLES" BLUE REVISIONS 20.5.2012          122.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN ON A WINDOW - Where two candle burn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valjean prays in the chapel, on his knees. He's very weak Next to the crucifix on the altar are Valjean's two silve candlesticks, in which two candles burn. VALJEAN Alone I wait in the shadows I count the hours till I can sleep. I dreamed a dream Cosette stood by It made her weep To know I die... Alone at the end of the day Upon this wedding night I pray Take these children, my Lord, to thy embrace And show them grace... God on high Hear my prayer Take me now To thy care Where you are Let me be Take me now Take me there Bring me home Bring me home!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VALJEAN is joined by the ghost of Fantine. She takes his as he prays. FANTINE M'sieur I bless your name... VALJEAN I am ready, Fantine... FANTINE M'sieur lay down your burden...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the end of my days... FANTINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You raised my child in love, VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's the best of my life... FANTINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you will be with God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosette and Marius rush round the cloisters and enter the chapel in the middle of the cloisters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of the door opening. Valjean looks round. It's Cosette entering, followed by Marius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosette? Tears form in his eyes. Cosette goes to him, kneels befor him, takes him in her arms. COSETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Papa, papa, I do not understand - Are you all right? Why did you go away? VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosette, my child! Am I forgiven now? Thank God, thank God, I've lived to see this day! Marius comes to him. MARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's you who must forgive a thoughtless fool! It's you who must forgive a thankless man! It's thanks to you that I am living, And again I lay down my life at your feet. Cosette, your father is a saint! When they wounded me He took me from the barricade, Carried like a babe, And brought me home to you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you are here Again beside me Now I can die in peace For now my life is blessed... COSETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will live, papa You're going to live It's too soon Too soon to say goodbye. VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Cosette, forbid me now to die! I'll obey I will try... He holds out a letter for her. VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On this page I write my last confession. Read it well When I at last am sleeping. It's the story Of one who turned from hating A man who only learned to love When you were in his keeping. Cosette takes the letter and kisses it. COSETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it, papa. Valjean turns back, face shining, towards the table where the candles burn in the silver candlesticks. There he see three ghosts waiting for him. The ghost of the Bishop. Th ghost of Fantine. And beyond her, watching Marius with love, the ghost of Eponine. Fantine comes towards him, reaching out her hands. VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ready now, Fantine. FANTINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with me Where chains will never bind you All your grief At last, at last behind you Lord in heaven Look down on him in mercy - VALJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive me all my trespasses And take me to your glory!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosette embraces Valjean, weeping. Valjean reaches up his hands, and lets the ghost of Fanti take them. FANTINE/EPONINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take my hand I'll lead you to salvation Take my love For love is everlasting... VALJEAN/FANTINE/EPONINE/BISHOP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And remember The truth that once was spoken: To love another person Is to see the face of God... Led by Fantine, Valjean walks out of the Chapel towards t cloister. What remains is Cosette, her head cradled in the lap of t man who has just died. The walls of the cloisters are covered in votive candles. The Bishop of Digne waits in front of the candles. Now Valjean's strong and young again. Before they reach the wall of candles, all three are gone. As they disappear we CRANE UP, high over the cloister, hi over the walls of the Convent and we see the Paris street outside. Fires are burning and debris is scattered in the streets. Dawn is breaking. From far away, the sound of an approaching crowd -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CAMERA MOVES over the cobbles as the light of the rising sun reveals the devastation left by a bitter stree battle. Past the remains of a barricade. The distant sound of an approaching march.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE CAPTION
dialogues.text: Sixteen years later Paris, 1848. From far off, the swelling sounds of the approaching marc become the words of a song. MARCHERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you hear the people sing Lost in the valley of the night? It is the music of a people Who are climbing to the light For the wretched of the earth (more)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCHERS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a flame that never dies Even the darkest night will end And the sun will rise. As THE CAMERA RISES we see we're in the Place de la Bastille. The triumphal column has long been completed, b the great elephant is sadly dilapidated and has become incorporated into an immense barricade - three stories high, seven hundred feet long. Down all the streets that converge on the square we now see the multiple victory marches approaching. They cheer and beat drums as they climb up to the top of the barricade.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE CAPTIONS
dialogues.text: The people of Paris have risen in their tens of thousands. The King has fled. A new Republic is born. There in the forefront of one column march Marius and Cosette. MARCHERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They will live again in freedom In the garden of the Lord They will walk behind the plough- share They will put away the sword The chain will be broken And all men will have their reward! As the marchers come nearer we begin to realise how many there are: thousand upon thousand. And there marching amo them we see ghosts from the past - Enjolras and the students who died - and Fantine - and Eponine - And out of the crumbling elephant peers another ghost: th grinning face of Gavroche. He climbs out to dance on the elephant, as the crowd fill the square. MARCHERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you join in our crusade? Who will be strong and stand with me? Somewhere beyond the barricade Is there a world you long to see? As the marchers converge, there watching them are Thenardier and his wife. Thenardier gives the marchers a wave of greeting. Survivors to the last. MARCHERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you hear the people sing? Say, do you hear the distant drums? (more)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCHERS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is the future that they bring When tomorrow comes! Now among the marchers we see the ghost of Valjean, singi with the rest atop the barricade, amongst the waving red flags. MARCHERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you join in our crusade? Who will be strong and stand with me? Somewhere beyond the barricade Is there a world you long to see? Do you hear the people sing? Say, do you hear the distant drums? It is the future that they bring When tomorrow comes... Tomorrow comes!
